summary: Yellow rust (stripe rust) is a damaging wheat disease that can spread quickly under cool, moist conditions.
cause: Caused by the fungus Puccinia striiformis. Favors cool temperatures (10–20°C) with moisture; spreads via wind-borne spores.
symptoms: Yellow to orange stripes or pustules along leaf veins. Severely infected plants have reduced tillering and grain filling leading to yield loss.
spread: Wind dispersal of spores enables rapid long-distance spread. Overwinters on volunteer cereals and alternative hosts in some regions.
treatment: Use registered fungicides when needed and follow integrated pest management recommendations. Timing of applications is critical for control.
prevention: Grow resistant cultivars, monitor weather and disease forecasts, remove volunteer hosts, and use crop rotation where possible.
